mods.abstract: Female child, Dutch doll, composition head and all body, jointed at shoulders and hips, sleeping eyes, open mouth with two teeth, blonde hair wig, long and curly, floral print underwear, black skirt, blue apron with embroidery needle-work, black velvet jacket, embroidery trimmed sleeve edges, black poncho-like shawl has tassel and golden heart-shaped button, needle work at back of shawl, blue plaid ribbon on front neck, black lace trimmed bonnet, needle-work, flat sole black shoes and knitted socks, manufactured doll body, costume, hand and machine-made. Accompanying information describes that this dutch doll was brought from Holland in the early 1960s. The dress is a typical Holland dress worn for celebrations. The needle-work is typical of that used in costumes in Holland. Doll's right limb was cracked vertically.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
